description: Unique identifier for interactions between a person and the healthcare system, linking events to a visit.
comment: Primary Key for the VISIT_OCCURRENCE table.

description: Unique identifier for the person associated with the visit.
Concept ID representing the type of visit (e.g., inpatient, outpatient, etc.).
Start date of the visit (e.g., admission date for inpatient visits).
Start datetime of the visit. If no time is given, set to midnight (00:00:0000).
End date of the visit (e.g., discharge date for inpatient visits). Default value for ongoing inpatient visits is the date of data pull.
End datetime of the visit. If no time is given, set to midnight (00:00:0000).
Concept ID representing the provenance of the visit record (e.g., EHR or claims data).
Identifier for the provider associated with the visit. Multiple providers can be reflected in VISIT_DETAIL.
Identifier for the Care Site where the visit took place.
Verbatim value from source data representing the type of visit (e.g., inpatient, outpatient, emergency).
Concept ID representing the coded source value of the visit.
Concept ID representing the location where the patient was admitted from (e.g., home or long-term care facility).
Source-provided value indicating where a person was admitted from.
Concept ID representing where the patient was discharged to (e.g., home or long-term care facility).
Source-provided value indicating where a person was discharged to.
Identifier for the visit immediately preceding the current visit. Note: not symmetrical.
